headline: AI Chips Update - Armenia Emerges As Key Player In Global AI Expansion
summary: The deployment of NVIDIA B300 Blackwell GPUs by Eleveight AI in Armenia marks a significant step in advancing the country's AI infrastructure capabilities. This deployment at Eleveight AI's dedicated data center will support various AI workloads, including generative AI and enterprise applications, leveraging the B300 GPUs' enhanced performance and scaling capabilities. The strategic implementation underscores a focus on infrastructure readiness, emphasizing power stability and operational...

headline: U.S. AI Stocks Edge Up Premarket After Thursday Losses
summary: U.S. artificial-intelligence-related stocks regained momentum premarket after largely falling Thursday, following a better-than-expected revenue report from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing. The world's largest contract chip maker announced a 32% increase in revenue, beating consensus expectations.

content.title: U.S. AI Stocks Edge Up Premarket After Thursday Losses
content.summary: U.S. artificial-intelligence-related stocks regained momentum premarket after largely falling Thursday, following a better-than-expected revenue report from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing. The world's largest contract chip maker announced a 32% increase in revenue, beating consensus expectations.

headline: Si2’s OpenAccess Coalition Announces 2026 Board of Directors
summary: ROUND ROCK, Texas, January 09, 2026--The OpenAccess Coalition is pleased to announce its 2026 Board of Directors, now representing 16 member companies. In 2025, the Coalition welcomed new representatives from Google and NVIDIA, further strengthening its leadership and commitment to advancing open standards in the semiconductor industry.

content.title: Si2’s OpenAccess Coalition Announces 2026 Board of Directors
content.summary: ROUND ROCK, Texas, January 09, 2026--The OpenAccess Coalition is pleased to announce its 2026 Board of Directors, now representing 16 member companies. In 2025, the Coalition welcomed new representatives from Google and NVIDIA, further strengthening its leadership and commitment to advancing open standards in the semiconductor industry.
